view

Class BoardPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • view.BoardPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BoardPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A BoardPanel object IS a Jpanel, it just specifies a little bit how the JPanel should look. A BoardPanel is a Jpanel populated by buttons(CellButton). Most Work is done in the default constructor(and some private helper methods). It does have a method to set The text of a button.
    Author:
    {}rpheus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardPanel(GameWindow window)
      Constructor uses some private helper methods to initialise the BoardPanel object, the helper methods: defineButtons(), addButtons() and addActionListner() deal with the buttons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardPanel

        public BoardPanel(GameWindow window)
        Constructor uses some private helper methods to initialise the BoardPanel object, the helper methods: defineButtons(), addButtons() and addActionListner() deal with the buttons. the rest is visual config for the JPanel.
